task-wr.title: Pinning a vCPU to a Shared Physical CPU
task-wr.shortdesc: You can pin a vCPU to a shared physical CPU by using a flavor with the required extra specification.

context.p: You can set up a shared physical CPU on the host to run low-load or non-real-time tasks for multiple VMs, freeing other cores on the host for dedicated high-load tasks. You can then use an extra spec to pin a specified vCPU to the shared physical CPU.
To add the required extra specification to a flavor using the web administration interface, use the Shared VCPU ID selection in the Create Flavor Extra Spec drop-down menu. To access this menu, see .

where vcpu_id is an integer that identifies the vcpu. The valid range starts at 0 and must be less than the VCPUs value defined for the flavor.

prereq.p: To use this extra spec, you must define a shared physical CPU on at least one host. For more information, see Titanium Server System Administration: . To support migration, shared physical CPUs on multiple hosts are recommended.

You must also set the CPU Policy extra specification for the flavor to Dedicated. This enables the high-load vCPUs for the instance to be pinned.
US64370 added noteThe CPU Thread Policy is incompatible with the Shared VCPU ID extra specification. Do not use both in the same flavor.
